description.$t:
Zuko is a giant dork dog. This 2 year old, 50 pound staffie mix came to us on literally the last bus out from a south Florida shelter as Hurricane Irma was closing in and it was leave town or be euthanized, so we took the entire shelter population in. 

Zuko is the happiest dog on the planet. He loves people, he loves dogs. He wants to play and he is happy, active and bouncy. Every day is the greatest day of Zuko's life and he needs a family committed to letting him do all the bouncing he wants. He is not the rocket scientist of the universe and he has zero ambition, but he is a sweet soul who loves life and he loves his people. His only knock is his too lustful stares at Karl the cat so he needs a no cat home. He will make an outstanding family pet. 

If you are interested in adopting this dog, please apply online, at http: https://bigfluffydogs.com/adopt/adoption-application/a nd then email jen.lu@bigfluffydogs.com.

. Our main website, www.bigfluffydogs.com has more information about us and the rescue process. NOTE TO EMAILERS FROM PETFINDER: WE DO NOT RESPOND TO EMAIL INQUIRIES WITHOUT AN APPLICATION. WE REGRET WE CANNOT RESPOND TO EVERY EMAIL, BUT UNLESS YOU FILL OUT AN APPLICATION, WE DO NOT KNOW YOU EXIST. All known information about an individual dog is provided in it's listing. We do our best to provide accurate information, but adopters must understand that each home is different and the dog may behave differently in a new home. Dogs are creatures of their environment and you help make the dog what it will be. Homes considering adopting a puppy must be prepared for:1.) Flexible schedules for potty training. Puppies can only "hold it" for one hour per month of age (ex. a 4 month old puppy can only go 4 hours without a potty break).2.) Crate training until the puppy is at least one year old, to prevent chewing on inappropriate things when you can't supervise.3.) Socialization: The more positive and varying experiences as a puppy the better, both in and out of your home.4.) Puppy behavior and life stages are equivalent to a human toddler. It takes at least a full year to have a calmer, well adjusted dog. Patience is required and when your dog's behavior is a positive experience for you and those around you, your patience will be rewarded tenfold, for years to come.Please do not consider adopting a puppy if you have not thoroughly thought through the pros and cons of having one. So many people end up returning them after 3-5 months because they didn't realize the amount of work involved in raising a puppy.Patience, appropriate toys, socialization, and obedience training are all musts. All are time consuming, and can be expensive.All Dogs Require:Supervision with children and obedience training. Adopters that want to have good dogs must be prepared to put the time and effort into training a dog. Any dog requires work and effort, but a well trained, well socialized dog is more than worth the effort put in to get them there.

Amelia is a 4 year old German shepherd mix weighing in at 100 pounds. Amelia lost her home because she was not good with livestock and in a farm environment, that's a problem. She was sad when she came to us because she loved her family, but she has rebounded nicely and is looking for her new home.

Amelia is housebroken, walks well on a leash, has a lower energy level and is all around easy in a house. She is great with people of all ages and has lived with children. She is also great with dogs, including little dogs, who she also lived with. She is not fabulous with cats or livestock and she needs a cat free, no livestock animal home.

Amelia is a perfect pet who will do well in the typical family home. Someone is going to love her. 

If you are interested in adopting this dog, please apply online, at http: https://bigfluffydogs.com/adopt/adoption-application/ and them email  audrey@bigfluffydogs.com.

Meet the dog with the most ridiculous name ever: Maraschino! She is a 4 yr. old, 45 lb, Pittie mix that we evacuated from a shelter in the path of Irma several months ago. She had obviously been someone's beloved pet because she had her own pink camo collar and pink painted toenails. She broke our hearts and there was no way we could leave her behind!

She is great with other dogs, and very easy-going. She loves to play, and when she meets new dogs her tail wags so fast it's a blur! She loves wrestling, and playing chase, and playing fetch (either with you or all by herself).

She has been great with all of the people (and kids) she has met, happy and affectionate. This girl has never met a stranger and wants to be everyone's best friend! She loves butt scratches and will happily show off her twerking skills in exchange for a good scratch. This girl is a typical happy-go-lucky Pittie, and is as sweet as her name!

She's not so great with cats however, so this is a no-cats kinda girl! 

She is medium to high energy and does best with a few long walks or play sessions per day, and then is perfectly content to cuddle. She will even wait for you to come tuck her in under a blank for her naps. She still pulls when on leash, although her foster family is working on this with her.

She already knows her basic commands, is trustworthy in the house, is crate trained and potty trained. This girl is seriously perfect and deserves her new forever home!

If you have an open spot on your couch and think Maraschino would be a fun name to call outside in your robe and slippers, please go to our website and fill out an adoption application (link below)! 

If you are interested in adopting this dog, please FIRST apply online, at https://bigfluffydogs.com/adopt/adoption-application/
Our Website www.bigfluffydogs.com has more information about us and the adoption process. If you still have questions, you can reach out to corey@bigfluffydogs.com.

NOTE TO EMAILERS FROM PETFINDER: WE DO NOT ALWAYS RESPOND TO EMAIL INQUIRIES WITHOUT AN APPLICATION DUE TO THE SHEER NUMBER WE GET DAILY. WE REGRET WE CANNOT RESPOND TO EVERY EMAIL, BUT UNLESS YOU FILL OUT AN APPLICATION, WE MIGHT NOT KNOW YOU EXIST. 

* BEHAVIOR DISCLAIMER: We do our best to provide accurate information, but adopters must understand that each home is different and the dog may behave differently in a new home. Dogs are creatures of their environment and you help make the dog what it will be. All dogs will require supervision with children, other dogs, and cats/other animals regardless of whether or not we have stated that the dog is friendly towards kids, cats, other dogs, etc. Slow introductions to other animals in the home, and allowing for them to have a separate space will make for better relationships in the future. Most dogs need an adjustment period when transitioning into a new home and there may be potty accidents, even if we have stated the dog is housebroken. All dogs should be somehow confined separately (crate or separate room) when left home alone until you can be sure the dog is trustworthy left loose. Separation anxiety can manifest if a dog is left alone more than it is used to in it's new home. This can be worked through and we are here to help. Please do not give up on your new dog without reaching out to us first!

Lucia was rescued from a very rural shelter where she ended up when her owner died. She wasn't in great shape and she has spent some time with us getting healthy and adjusting to life as a beloved house pet. She has made great strides in her foster home, and although she is still shy, she now appreciates the company of people and enjoys getting affection and attention. 

She gets along well with other dogs who are mellow like her.  She ignores cats and has been fine living with them.  She has been around children and does fine with them as long as they are passed the screeching years and can respect her space. (Thinking 8+ is best)

She walks well on leash and she enjoys slow strolls. She would also LOVE to have a fenced yard to patrol. She is crate trained and potty trained and is trustworthy left loose in the house as long as there isn't a steak left on the counter. 

She will never be the life of the party, but she is sweet and will repay people's patience with steadfast love and loyalty. 

If you are interested in adopting this dog, please FIRST apply online, at https://bigfluffydogs.com/adopt/adoption-application/
Our Website www.bigfluffydogs.com has more information about us and the adoption process. If you still have questions, you can reach out to corey@bigfluffydogs.com.

Meet Jolie! The last of the soulful 7 group to be placed in a good forever home. She's been through a lot of tough and rough patches. Exact age is unknown, guessed to be about 8. However, she thinks she's 2 in the playful pup mind set. Her former life has caused her to have a lot of trust issues. Especially in/with other dogs. She must be placed in a home where she w/b the ONLY pet. She is as loving and wonderful as she is gorgeous. Is GREAT on a leash and loves walks. American cheese slices are her fav treat, she'll do anything for cheese. Really! Isn't there someone who wants to give Jolie a warm loving furever home. PS, she gives wonderful kisses too, but won't howl for anything and rarely barks.

In Greek mythology, Atlas was a Titan condemned to hold up the sky for eternity after the Titanomachy.   For travelers, an atlas was first generation roadmap.  If you're a new car buyer you may be considering the Volkswagen Atlas minivan.  For Big Fluffy Dog lovers, Atlas is a 2.5 year old Anatolian/GSD cross. That's the one we'll talk about today.  

Atlas is basically a giant puppy.  Although we have no doubt that he'll be able to bear the weight of the world on his shoulders (this guy will be 100+ pounds), we're not sure he wouldn't try to toss it up in the air and catch it, too.  Atlas has the high prey drive and energy common to GSDs.  Atlas may be best suited to a home with any other dogs.  If you are a  cat free home with older, sturdy (remember, he's 100+ pounds of puppy) children and think this guy is for you, please email audrey@bigfluffydogs.com after you fill out the adoption application at https://bigfluffydogs.com/adopt/adoption-application/

Hannah started off as a street stray in the inner city of Detroit.  She was rescued by a man who gave her to his brother and his wife, but she had illness and wasn't able to walk her or take financial care of her.    Hannah is a needy little girl.  She NEEDS someone who can have her with them all the time.  She's good with other animals but we want to adopt her into a home with no young chidlren who may steal the lime light from her, and maybe only one other pet that will love her so she has a buddy.   

She's not crateable, she's not interested in toys or anything other than her people.  She loves long walks, she's really needing a fenced yard and a pet parent who's active enough to walk her often and be home with her or be able to take her along with them.  She just wants to lay on you, makes it a little hard to get things done but she just needs a best friend.

She's only about 17 pounds.   No apartment or mobile home parks will be considered. She likes  a quiet household during this time.  Call or text me at 517 294 4514 or email me at marlas2468@yahoo.com  She is a sweetheart and deserves the best treatment after all she's been through.

This is sweet Mona, originally she was Kona.  Mona has a heartbreaking story. 

She came in as a 10 month old owner turn in.  She was VERY high energy and the shelter didn't want to try and place her.  I was able to get her out of the shelter and Jen who was a runner, was very excited to find a young dog who had the energy to run with her daily.  

Jen and Mona became very tightly bonded as a pet parent and her little girl.   Last year Jen was in a very high speed car accident, she was run off the road coming home from work and went under a semi.  Jen broke her ankle and her back. Mona was devasted seeing Jen coming home from the hospital and she didn't leave her side. 


Jen and Mona had to move home to Jen's parents home, losing her job, her apartment and was bed bound for nearly a year.  Mona needs to be run daily, she has a lot of energy and Jen was having her parents exercise Mona hoping she would soon recover.  

Mona was by Jen's side constantly and became her nurse maid.  After two failed surgeries to repair Jen's spine and ankle, recently came the news Jen was not expecting to hear.  Only 25 years old, Jen will not be recovering any time soon if at all.  The surgeons can't seem to get her surgeries to heal her ankle and her spine might need more time than they had projected.  Without Mona Jen wasn't sure she could pull through, but now it's been more than a year and Mona is getting very impatient with the slow recovery and Jen's parents can not exercise Mona enough to keep her happy.   

Jen has decided it could be years IF she does recover.  Devasted she has decided it's best for her little girl to go to a pet parent who can continue her daily runs, without that outlet Mona gets anxious and can get out of hand.  With the exercise she's a angel.  

We are looking for a non smoking home with a VERY active runner or hiker who can be home with her, or working from home.   She needs property to live on and she is NOT good with other animals but is good with older children. 

  She is VERY faithful to her person and she'd do great with agility or having a job to focus on.  She's good with people, adults, and she's somewhat of a rare dog.  She's a Kelpie mix, about 45 pounds, tons of energy. This website didn't even have Kelpie as a breed you could choose to list him.

 Kelpies are working dogs, so those kinds of herding dogs need a job to do or they get bored.  She's three years old, loves car rides, and she's cute as a button.   She's housebroken loves being a inside pup, but LOVES long walks through the woods or runs on trails.  She could be exercised by jogging along a bicycle or keeping her pet parent in shape.   

If you think you would love a faithful rare breed pup who will be your best constant companion, please call or text me at 517 294 4514.  Or email me at marlas2468@yahoo.com   Jen will be extremely sad to lose Mona, she has been dealing with this decision for nearly a year now and she's come to grips with the fact that sometimes, if you love someone enough, you have to do what is best for them.  Mona has waited a long year for Jen to recover and it's been very tough on her to sit by and watch Jen lay in bed.  Jen says she never has loved anyone as much as she does Mona, that Mona is her best friend ever.   Mona desparately needs a person or couple or family with young adults to become her new family and enjoy her, she's had a tough go of things.

This is sweet loving Freddie.  He is a awesome little Westie mix.  

 He has been through so much.  He was unlucky enough to be put into a rescue a few years ago who did not place him in a safe home.   He was a two year old healthy dog with a rescue who carelessly placed him in a family they did not follow up on or monitor during his first placement days and didn't find out till years later that he was in a deep neglect situation.  

The family notified the rescue a year ago, that they no longer wanted to keep him.  When the rescue went to go check on the situation a YEAR later they found he had been isolated, not cared for or loved even. His nails were SO long and over grown, he was having trouble walking. He was feed horrible unhealthy dog food and given all kinds of in appropriate foods that were not even fit for a healthy human. 

Right now the rescue who originally placed him doesn't want him back or to rehome him.  This is a issue with large rescues, they want the fast, easy to place dogs and do not always stand by their placed dogs. 

Together the rescue and the owners had decided not to do anything with him but have him put down.  He was depressed and needs simple love and care and this is where I was called in.  

Freddie started off as a happy healthy doggie and we are HAPPY to report her is once again. Luckliy Freddie is a very happy now, my what a little love can do....  During this neglect he lost his sight, it's tradgic ........he is learning to deal wtih the world on the hand he's been dealt with.    He has started wanting to play, he's lost weight and is moving so much better and just enjoying life again.

'He loves to be talked to, belly rubs, long walks and just being with you.   He's even great with cats and kids that are about seven or older.  Ones that understand not to come at him too fast or blind side him.  He wants to play with kids for short periods, so for someone with Grandchildren who visit often he'd be fine.    He does learn the house and does quite well in navigating.  Freddie has turned into a wonderful and loving dog again.  He's attentive, gets aroun quiet well. 

  We have done all his vetting  and he's healthy after all, thank God.  He's overweight and dropping the pounds quickly.   With each passing day he is more perky and loving.     He's about a third of the way to his weight loss in only three weeks. 

Fred needs someone who needs someone to care for and accept the love he wants so desparately wants to share.  He's awesome wtih cats and would be in heaven to have a larger older dog to hang with.  A bigger dog, older dog, to be his eyes and someone to interact with on his level, the floor.   A safe fenced yard where he can roam off leash and follow his nose and roll in the grass to his hearts content.  He doesn't get on furniture and he can't manuver a colonial house or home with a lot of stairs.  He can do a few, but many would be dangerous for him. 

He should be back to his normal weight of 15 pounds or so soon.  If you think you can open your home and heart to a dog who is so much in need and can be a great little companion for someone.  He needs tenderness, love, exercise and a lttle time.  If you think Freddie sounds like a soul you would like to be involved with helping save and maybe adopt your self, call or text me at 517 294 4514 or email me at marlas2468@yahoo.com

Zeke is in a emergency situation.  He was a happy dog in a home with his owner.   There was a sudden family situation and a woman moved into the home with a little baby who is highly allergic to dogs.  

She actually threatened to release the dog into the streets of Detroit because the baby has trouble breathing and the owner of the home and dog are working and gone often.   Zeke is a sweet boy, good with dogs, and kids, he's a Shepherd Husky mix.   Five years old, 60 pounds.  We need to get him into foster care or a adoptive home immediately.   A non smoking home.

Call or text us for info if you can take him into your world and give him the love he's used to having.   We have him up to date on shots and he's ready to go. He'd be best off in a home with a yard and someone who has time to be with him, we will not consider apartments or trailer parks.  

Call or text 517 294 4514 or email us at marlas2468@yahoo.com

Sally is a special girl who has been through a LOT!!  She is slow to trust and does not like loud noises. She breaks our hearts because she is a dog whose spirit has been broken and the sadness in her eyes said it all. Many people have worked with her and she has worked hard to become more comfortable. She loves walks and just running around with her person but does not like being left outside - probably a result of having been kept outside full time in previous years. We will be adding more about her later, but will be looking for a quiet, calm, indoor home for this sweet girl. She is nonaggressive but does not really play much - other than with her daughter Sophie sometimes. She does smile on command if she's relaxed.  She is well behaved and obedient in the house now. She does like the security of a crate as her bed and looks for it when she comes in.  She loves to eat.  She rarely barks.  We think she is around 5-6 years old and weighs about 65 pounds.

 She has had at least 3 large litters (13 in one) as her previous rescue said they could not catch her to spay her for a while. When we got her, we also got the surviving "children" from her last litter, who were 1-2 years old and some were running wild, and the others were confined in outdoor pens full time. Most were not socialized.  Sophie is the last of her litter and the two are together currently. 

Please text or phone 734-645-7705 for more information. Sally's adoption fee is $200 but may be negotiable to the right home.  Sally has been with us since June 2013. :-((

NO CATS FOR THIS GIRL! !  (She will kill them).  She is good with other dogs and is more comfortable with another dog her size around.

Introducing Elgen! This sweet boy is looking for a home and would love for it to be with you! Elgen is sweet, social and quiet and would like a home that is also quiet where he can spend his retirement years relaxing and spreading love.

PLEASE READ BELOW IF INTERESTED IN THIS DOG! 

IF YOU ARE SEEING THIS LISTING, THEN THE DOG IS STILL AVAILABLE AND WE ARE PROCESSING INQUIRIES FOR ITS NEW HOME. We remove them immediately once we have stopped taking inquiries and have a pending home.

PLEASE FOLLOW THE DIRECTIONS BELOW TO BE CONSIDERED. Please provide a contact phone number! Once we narrow down to the top three candidates, we usually call them to discuss details and then make our choice to meet the dog. Those who send no information about your home or family, or just ask is the dog available, how much, or how old will not be answered. All of that information is listed here and unfortunately, due to the volume of inquiries asking those basic questions, we are unable to answer all of the emails and texts. We also get a lot of people who send in the basic question because of the cute factor and really are not ready to adopt yet.

We understand that some of this is due to the new Petfinder "format" with their basic question at the bottom and apologize for that. In addition we are getting duplicates from most people because of Petfinder's new system which is making it difficult to tell if your inquiry was sent to us. Also the Petfinder "new system" asks for a zip code or location but does not forward that to us so we cannot tell your location. We are getting a lot of complaints from prospective homes trying to navigate Petfinder's new system and unfortunately we cannot do anything about their new format and the removal of the information on our home page, etc. Someone there obviously thinks all the pages should look the same and have removed the individual aspects of the system. Many people are simply sending their information to us directly at petangels@gmail.com or via text or voicemail to 734-645-7705 which may be a simpler solution at this point. 

Posted 2-23-18:
We will try to get new pictures of this girl soon.  These were taken the day we brought her to the foster home and she was nervous and afraid and unsure why she was being taken from her old home.  They do not do her justice!

Jurie is a purebred German Shepherd and is in great shape for her age.  It's hard to believe she is a senior as she does not act her age at all.  Jurie is about 9 years old and finds herself in need of a new home to love her as much as her previous owners do.   Jurie was a spoiled "only child" for 7 years and then her humans had a two-legged child!!  Unfortunately for everyone, Jurie was never socialized well around babies and she doesn't understand.  She has a typical prey drive that some of the German Shepherds can display and she tried to nip at the baby as it was trying to crawl.  Didn't hurt him but the second time it happened was enough to caution the parents and force them to choose between the safety of their son and their dog.  Being a senior dog too, we feel that they did make the right choice.

We were cautioned that Jurie has not been around a lot of other dogs either and may not be good with them.  We have been moving slowly with her but she is in a foster home with other dogs and cats and is integrating well.  She was nervous at first and we still don't leave her unattended but she is able to mingle fine with supervision.  She tends to retreat to her crate if she gets nervous.  She has actually made friends with a lab there and now has a buddy she is comfortable with.  Jurie has great house manners and is well trained to commands - some in German.  She is housebroken and crate trained.  She is a very loving dog and a great companion.  

We have listed her as not good with children, dogs, or cats due to her history.  However, we want potential adopters to also understand that she is NOT a vicious dog or one that will lunge or go after other dogs, etc.  She can be walked without issue and has done well going into pet stores, etc.  She has greeted older children and adults fine.  She also listens well and if there is any concern (such as when she met our 4 lb chihuahua with a major attitude, who thinks he weighs 100 pounds!) and she is told to "leave it" she immediately responded and walked away.

She is in great health but can be prone to skin allergies if she is off of her medicine or given low quality food.  She does not display any arthritis or hip problems.  She loves to go for walks and takes stairs in stride.

If interested in adopting, please call or text 734-645-7705 and leave your name, location, brief summary of family, work hours, dog experience, training and exercise plans, and a phone contact number.  You may also email us at petangels@gmail.com with the same information.

Adoption fee is $250 (cash with receipt or Paypal), possibly negotiable to the right home.   Any excess fee above her direct expenses is used to support the other seniors, abuse and neglect cases, and adult dogs working through issues and training in our rescue.  Thank you.

UPDATED 2-23-18:
Monica has been in a new foster home for the last couple months and is doing very well.  She has learned to integrate into the home.  The consensus is still that she would probably be happier as an only dog as she wants attention for herself, but she might also be able to go to a home with another compatible dog.  She does not have experience with children and tends to bark at them.  Please call 734-645-7705 for more information on Monica if you think she may be a good fit for your home.  She is now going outside to do her business and no longer uses the pee pads.  She is fostered in Ypsilanti.

12-24-17:
Monica has settled in some now and is learning our routine and experiencing new things and we thought it was time to update her listing.

We have removed her from the special needs category as we are finding her to just be another baby needing love. She is good with the cats, good with other dogs her size, still a bit nervous around the big dogs but getting there, and good with gentle children. She still is nervous with loud noises or yelling.

She is quite reliable on per pads but is also learning to go outside now. She mainly just wants to be by you and on the couch or chair with you!!

Original listing:

Monica just lost the only mom she ever knew who passed away unexpectedly.  She is very insecure and craves love and attention but is afraid to accept it when she first meets. She was nipping at another dog in the house and trying to crowd in for attention.  The family members cannot keep her.

She is very nervous in the car and we think she was rarely taken anywhere.  She eventually calmed some after about an hour once held tightly in a blanket but had severe anxiety.

She is trained to pee pads. 

She needs a very patient home that will help her to trust and socialize and will be home with her a lot.

She will watch out the window and bark at people or cars. She would not be well suited to apartment living due to her loud bark.

She is an excellent watch dog.

Please call or text 734-645-7705 if interested in giving Monica a home.

UPDATES 3-16-18:
We were able to speak with  Barneys previous vet and we learned that his birthday is 4-27-06, so he is almost 12 instead of 14!!  He is quite physically fit and he got his shots updated and was heartworm tested negative. 

Posted 2-22-18:

Barney is a 14 year old chocolate lab who was left behind when his owner passed away.  He is an older boy but in great shape and does not act his age.  He loves to just follow you around and be near you.  More on this boy coming soon. 

If interested in adopting, please call or text 734-645-7705 and leave your name, location, brief summary of family, work hours, dog experience, training and exercise plans, and a phone contact number.

Eros should definitely win an award for having the cutest ears ever. This sweet boy has a face that's just begging for a smooch on the forehead. This darling boy is a little shy at first, but once he's comfortable with his new family, he'll be so much fun! He is quite the athlete, so he'll need an active family to keep up with him. No couch potatoes here! We know you'll love Eros just as much as we do!

Are you looking for a strong, handsome man who loves to cuddle, has a sensitive side, and wants to be exclusive with you? Then you can delete your Tinder; Come meet Arran instead! Hes a buff and bouncy boy who loves learning new things, licking faces, and long walks on the beach. He needs a patient and loving adopter who is willing to put in some time and teach him basic manners, as well as how to give cheek kisses without accidentally bowling over the recipient of his love. Arran is a high energy boy who needs lots of playtime, and will prefer a home without kids under 12 as well as with no other dogs. Come take Arran on a first date today

Gino is looking for a home where he can be shown that humans are able to give love. This little cutie had a bit of a rough start to life, but he is ready to find his forever home! He is a bit on the nervous side, but he is as sweet as can be! With love, TLC and slow introductions he will become your best buddy! So if you are looking for a wonderful new companion come and meet Gino today!

Meet Daisy, a sweet little lady available for adoption! She is a low-key lady who would appreciate a slower acclimation to her new environment. Once she warms up, she is all love and snuggles. Come meet Daisy today!

Are you looking for a new best friend? If you are you should meet Zoey! This gorgeous girl is a bit shy, but with some gentle attention and TLC she will become your buddy in no time! Zoey is an older girl, but she still loves to play and have a good time! She also loves snuggling, car rides and attention. If you are looking for a new addition to your family come and meet Zoey today! Zoey is currently living in one of our wonderful foster homes. Adopting from foster is easy! Please email adoptions@hshv.org or call (734)662-5585 to arrange to meet Zoey today!

PLEASE READ BELOW IF INTERESTED IN THIS DOG! 

IF YOU ARE SEEING THIS LISTING, THEN THE DOG IS STILL AVAILABLE AND WE ARE PROCESSING INQUIRIES FOR ITS NEW HOME. We remove them immediately once we have stopped taking inquiries and have a pending home.

PLEASE FOLLOW THE DIRECTIONS BELOW TO BE CONSIDERED. Please provide a contact phone number! Once we narrow down to the top three candidates, we usually call them to discuss details and then make our choice to meet the dog. Those who send no information about your home or family, or just ask is the dog available, how much, or how old will not be answered. All of that information is listed here and unfortunately, due to the volume of inquiries asking those basic questions, we are unable to answer all of the emails and texts. We also get a lot of people who send in the basic question because of the cute factor and really are not ready to adopt yet.  Please make sure that all of your household members are ready to adopt before pursuing adoption.

We understand that some of this is due to the new Petfinder format with their basic question at the bottom and apologize for that. In addition we are getting duplicates from most people because of confusion with Petfinder's new system which is making it difficult to tell if your inquiry was sent to us. Also the Petfinder new system asks for a zip code or location but does not forward that to us so we cannot tell your location. We do not fly our animals so please make sure that you are able to drive to Michigan if you are interested in one of our pets.  We are getting a lot of complaints from prospective homes trying to navigate Petfinder's new system and requests from several who enjoyed the various sections of our previous home page.  We cannot do anything about the changes to the format and the removal of the information on our home page, etc. Many people are simply sending their information to us directly at petangels@gmail.com or via text or voicemail to 734-645-7705 which may be a simpler solution at this point.

Posted 4-9-18:

King is 4 1/2 months old and looking for a home to love him forever. He is a purebred chihuahua but his father is larger.  King could be up to about ten pounds full grown but has short legs like his mother.   Mom is the small chihuahua shown in the background in the picture.  He is very shy at first and will need patience to bring him out of his shell.  He has a very submissive nature due to the dominant nature of his mother.  He does well with other animals.

If anyone is looking for two chihuahuas and has an appropriate home, King and his mama Lily would like to go together but Lily is not good around children and strangers and generally prefers women over men.  We realize this makes her more difficult to adopt and we will certainly consider adopting them separately so that King is not held back from getting a home due to her issues.  

King has been training to pee pads so far and will need further work on housebreaking.

Adoption fee is $395 each (cash with receipt or Paypal). Spay/neuter agreement must be signed to be completed by 6 months of age.

Posted 4-9-18:

Tom and Jerry are about 6 months old and looking for homes to love them forever. They are beagle and boston terrier mixes ("Boggle" for those who like to  call mutts by their "designer" names).   They are about 6 months and could be up to 20 pounds full grown.    They are medium to high energy and Tom can be dominant with other animals.     Tom will need someone with training experience.  They can be separated.  

They have been using pee pads some and will need further work on housebreaking.  They are pretty well crate trained.

If interested in adopting, please call or text 734-645-7705 and leave your name, location, brief summary of family, work hours, dog experience, training and exercise plans, and a phone contact number. 

Adoption fee is $395 each (cash with receipt or Paypal). They are neutered and shots are completed including their first rabies.

Perfect, popular, playful, phenomenal, precious, pretty pitty princess Pebbles is here to teach you about alliteration! This wiggly and happy girl oozes sunshine out of her every pore. Pebbles is the star of any party with her winning smile, waggy butt, and her great party trick of flipping over for belly rubs. Nothing makes her smile more than a good snuggle session or a good game of fetch. If Pebbles has one flaw, it's that she loves people so much that she doesn't want to share her people with other dogs. Pebbles is currently living in one of our wonderful foster homes. Adopting from foster is easy! Please email adoptions@hshv.org or call (734)662-5585 to arrange to meet Pebbles today! Pebbles can't wait to be your very best friend.

Renalda is the kind of girl who would sing "I don't think you're ready for this jelly" into a hairbrush while dancing in the mirror. This adorable little tank is such a joy to be around. She has lots of energy, so she'll need an active family that will help her get in her exercise. Despite what her jiggly butt might suggest, she loves to run in crazy puppy circles. New toys put a huge smile on her face, much like the smile she's sure to put on yours!

Meet Sugar! This sweet and fun lady is so full love and life. Despite her size she can be quite playful and exuberant so she will need an owner that can give her the playtime and exercise she needs and craves. Come in today to meet Sugar and you will surely leave with your new best friend.

There are many dogs in this world, but nothing can compare to the amazingness of Bowzer. This gentle beast is looking for a home to call all his own. At 3-years-old, Bowzer is still getting used to the indoor lifestyle. He's a little aloof when it comes to the slippery floors and looks like a chicken on wheels, but we are slowly working with him. He loves to go for walks, cuddle with his favorite people and show off his adorable self. Bowzer will need a home without small children (preferably under 12) where he can continue to learn his basic manners, release all that energy he needs to burn and be the dog he's always wanted to be. If you are interested in learning more about Bowzer, he is available for adoption today!

Do you have lots of experience with dogs? Are you willing to welcome a dog into your life that might need some extra time to acclimate? Are you looking for a new best friend? If you are you should meet Lulu! This precious girl is still building up her confidence, but she is slowly starting to find her brave side! Lulu would thrive in a quiet home where she can get the gentle love and TLC she needs and deserves. Lulu is currently living in one of our wonderful foster homes. Adopting from foster is easy! Please e-mail adoptions@hshv.org or call 734.662.5585 to arrange to meet Lulu today!

Are you an active individual looking for a dog to keep up with you? Then take Kix out on a walk! This handsome black and white pitty is so much fun! He will need lots of exercise, playtime and mental stimulation to keep him happy and fulfilled. Since he's just a young boy, he will need a family that will help him learn his basic manners, too. Please come meet Kix today!

Meet Stanley! The most handsome Coonhound you've ever seen! Stanley would love to go to a home where he can run, play and baroo to his hearts content. Stanley is a senior dog, but don't let his age fool you! He still has the energy and pizazz of a young pup. If your ideal weekend consists of hiking, running, playing in the yard or walking down nature trails Stanley may just be the dog for you! Stanley not only loves physical exercise, but mental exercise as well! He is such a smart pooch, and will need lots of mental stimulation to keep that big brain active. So if you love hounds, come down and meet Stanley today!

Do you love to cuddle? If you do you have to meet Neno! This handsome hunk of beefy love is the absolute best! Neno can often to be seen snuggling with his stuffed animals and begging for pets from his adoring fans. This wiggly beefcake would love to go to a home where he can get showered in the love and attention he deserves. If your ideal evening includes snuggling on a comfy couch watching Netflix, Neno just might be the dog for you! Neno has heartworm which means that this dog has parasitic worms in the right ventricle of the heart and nearby blood vessels. Heartworm is transmitted from one dog to another by mosquitoes and can be easily prevented using monthly heartworm preventative, but once the disease is contracted the treatment process can be quite intensive. Neno will need to remain sedentary with minimal activity during the treatment process to ensure a healthy recovery. There is additional information on heartworm disease and treatment available at our Adoption Desk.

Halene is a supreme social butterfly. This little cocoa colored pitty is as sweet as milk chocolate! She loves making friends with everyone (and climbing in their laps). Halene would love a home where she will get lots and lots of playtime and oodles of snuggles. Come meet this wonder dog today!

Lorna is the queen of fun! This silly little puppy is total clown. She loves to romp and play and have a grand ol' time! She has the Energizer Bunny of the dog world-she keeps going and going and going! Lorna is looking for an active family that can keep up with her and also provide her lots of puzzles to solve! If Lorna sounds like the silly goose you need in your life, come meet her today!

Are you looking for a smart, funny and super friendly dog? If you are you should meet Anna! This pup is super smart, super playful and loves to learn new things! She would really benefit from a home where she can get lots of mental and physical enrichment and loads and loads of playtime. Anna would also benefit from some training classes where she can keep her big ol' brain active! If you are looking for a young dog that can grow with you come and meet Anna today!

Puffin the perfect pocket pitty is ready to be your pal! This sweet little girl might be a little shy right now, but once she feels safe, she's so sweet, friendly, and playful. She is looking for a home where she can get a slow introduction then get lots of playtime! She will need a fair amount of exercise and some work with her basic training. If Puffin sounds like the pal for you, come meet her today.

Do you think otters are super cute? Well feast your eyes on this Otter! This handsome boy is a bit on the shy side, however with some gentle attention, love and TLC we are sure he will become a confident pooch in no time! He would benefit from a home where he can get the mental and physical exercise he needs to stay happy and healthy. He would also really benefit from a slower intro to new people/places with some extra positive reinforcement training to help him build confidence. If you are looking to add a new friend into your life, look no further than Otter!

Meet Vaquita! A beautiful, bouncy black and tan pitty! This little sweetheart has quiet the playful side and lots of energy! She would thrive in a home where she can get the physical and mental enrichment she needs to stay happy and healthy. Vaquita would also benefit from some training classes, such as basic manners. If you are looking for a happy dog to add to your family, Vaquita may be the pooch for you!

Meet Nelly! He Is A 6 Year Old Male Boxer/American Bulldog Mix. He Is Neutered, Up To Date On Vaccines, Heartworm Negative, And Microchipped. He Is Currently Being Treated For Hookworm And Has One Pill Left To Take And Should Be Good To Go. What Can I Say About This Goofball. He Is Amazing! Hes A Big Ole Baby! He LOVES Everyone He Meets And Has No Issues With Strangers Or Kids. He Has Not Shown One Ounce Of Aggression At All. He Hasnt Been Socialized Around Other Animals And Has Proved To Be A Cat Chaser. Nelly Has Been Slowly Introduced To The Resident Dogs And Over Time Has Come To Accept Them And Is Able To Now Be Part Of The Pack. Im Not Sure How He Would Be With Other Dogs, It Would Take Take And Work To Put Him In A Home With Other Dogs.  He Loves Kids Though And Has Really Enjoyed Hanging Out At My 10 Year Olds Football Games On The Weekends.He Is On Point Trained. He Has Never Once Had An Accident Or Marked In My Home. He Will Walk Right Into His Crate When I Say "Bed Time". He Knows "Sit" And "Stay" And We Are Working On Doorway Boundaries. He Has Some Bulldog Pushyness And It Mostly Comes Out When He Wants To Snuggle. He Does Not Take No For An Answer. Ive Been A Human Shaped Dog Bed More Since We Have Been Fostering Nelly Than Ever Before. He Just Cant Seem To Get Close Enough To His People. He Is A 55# Lap Dog. He Does Also Like To Climb. As You Can See In His Photos He Enjoys Sleeping In The Cat Tower. Weirdo Dog! We Will Be Looking For At Least A 6 Ft Fence As He Can Climb A 4 Ft No Problem. We Have Kept Him On A Lead At Our Home. He Does Pretty Good Off-Leash As Long As You Are Paying Attention To Him And Has Excellent Voice Recall. Ill Make This Promise. Ehoever Adopts This Boy Wont Ever Give Him Up. Hes Hilareous And A Joy To Have Around. His Bad Habits Are Minor And Are Workable. One Last Note Is His Tongue. We Arent Sure If Its A Birth Defect Or Trauma But He Cannot Atick His Tongue All The Way In His Mouth. This Does Make Him A Bit Of A Drooler At Times. It Doesnt Bother Him But Will Need To Be Paid Attention To On Cold Winter Days. He Eats Fine Although Can Be Messy With His Food Bowl As He Eats From The Side Of His Mouth. He Also Can Only Give Kisses If You Happen To Be On That Side Of His Face. His Adoption Donation Is $260.  For more uodates, pictures, and videos of Nelly please "LIKE" us on facebook. Facebook.com/AllforkarmaAnimalRescue. Visit Allforkarmaanimalrescue.com to fill out an application to adopt.

Meet Abby! She about 4.5 years old now and is seeking a forever home where she can be an only dog. Shes fine with cats and absolutely adores her people. She is a lazy couch potato type. He can be a bit skittish so may be better with older or calmer children. Walks well on a leash and likes car rides. You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Missy is the most awesome dog you'll ever meet. She walks awesome on a leash she knows a vocabulary of commands. She love love loves the water she loves taking baths she loves playing in the water. She has the most awesome personality. She's a couch potato that also gets bursts of energy. She came to us in 2015 under weight with a shattered hip and a tumor on her toe running the streets with her son Buddy (whom has since been adopted). We fixed up her hip took the tumor off her toe and she is fit as a fiddle. She's not a barker unless she's talking back to you and to trying get you to do something she's silly like that. I own a cat and she's fine around her as long as we are watching and the cat is dog Savvy anyways so she knows to stay away and not to pester. Oh and she loves kids too. She is so very deserving of a loving family of her own so she doesn't have to share with the foster siblings. Please if you have a fenced-in yard love in your heart and room on your bed and couch this girl is for you!!!I can always count on Missy to make me smile. This gorgeous girl is wonderful with other dogs, cats and adores kids! Missy had a lousy start before coming to us. She and her traveling companion Buddy were picked up by a great guy who cared enough to stop and get them both in his car before the could have been hit by a car on a major road. You may remember Missy had a shattered hip and a large mass that we had surgery on. She is on the mend and doing very well. Please help us share this beauty (both inside and out). She really needs a family of her own. Whoever is fortunate to find their way to her will not be disappointed!** All Buster dogs require a fully fenced yard.**Before meeting any Buster dog an application must be completed.http://thebusterfoundation.rescuegroups.org/forms/ 4/1/18 12:09 AM

You can fill out an adoption application online on our official website.Vegas is an active little lady that loves toys, flirt pole, car rides and snuggling in bed. No cats or small kids, please. Vegas is 44 lbs and 2.5 years old. She has been through basic obedience training (sit, lay down, recall). Vegas has moderate to high food drive, moderate toy drive and high prey drive (aka she is squirrel crazy!). Great potential for dog sports! Vegas would also make a great jogging buddy. She is selective with other dogs, prefers males. Vegas would do best as an only dog or with ONE compatible male dog in the house. Please, no homes with multiple dogs or other female dogs. Adoption fee is $200 (which will be donated back to the Buster Foundation!). Vegas is spayed, up-to-date on all shots, heartworm negative, microchipped, and crate trained. If interested please fill out an adoption application or contact her foster mom at: pitbullsoul@gmail.com or 313-702-5501 if you have questions. 4/1/18 12:09 AM

Ms. Josephine is quite the sophisticated older lady! Sheâs a 10 year old small breed mix with all the traits needed for being a lady of leisure in her golden years. She knows you get more love with honey than vinegar and is always ready with a cheerful greeting for friends and strangers alike. Josephine learned early on that you need to keep yourself healthy and still enjoys taking brisk walks during the day to keep herself in shape. She has a few mild age related health concerns but knows keeping her spirits up is the key to living a long enjoyable life. She adores food and treats but has excellent table manners and even when she occasionally snorts she always excuses herself to be polite. Josephine also knows the importance of friendships. She enjoys spending time with her best friend Kalie and would love a home where they both would be welcome. Ring us today to meet Josephine (and Kalie); sheâs spayed, vaccinated and micro-chipped. Call Friends of Michigan Animals Rescue at 734 461-9458 or visit our website fmar1.org for more information. 4/14/18 2:32 PM

Morning Satinka, our Tink, was purchased from an Auction and was said to be pregnant. Upon checking Tink, it was found that she was 10 years of age and although they tried to breed her, instead she had mammary tumors and was very underweight and scared. Like the butterfly that morphs from a caterpillar, Tink has shed her sadness and her shyness and has learned to live each day fully and her progress has been both in the physical state and most importantly her mental personality that has blossomed. She is a favorite of all that meet or care for her and our hope for Tink is that she finds a solid foster or forever home where she can show her new found zest for life.

Hi my name is Munchkin and I came to GRACE from West Virginia. I did have a racing career (70 races) and was also a mom to 8+ pups. 

Munchkin is a sweetheart. She takes a few days to warm up but than isn't afraid to ask for attention or treats. She is also a slow eater and took a week before she ate a full meal without bribing. She likes to play with toys and the other hounds and loves the kids to the point of being a little overwhelming if they are too small. She loved playing with our 13 year old grandson, him giggling and her tail wagging. 

She does stairs with ease and has no trouble with the floors. She thinks she might like to try being a guard dog, giving a little woof when she hears a strange sound after dark. She is good on the leash and rides well in the car after you help her in. She is not cat safe. She still needs to be tested around small dogs and other breeds of dogs.

Â Rusty weighs approximately 35 pounds, is crate trained and is house trained. Â Rusty is a purebred Shiba Inu and true to his breed. Â  He can get protective with things he should not have (sticks he picks up on walks for example) but since he is very fond of cheese he can be easily distracted.  He will make a nice addition to the right home. Our adoption radius is within 60 miles of Canton, MI as home visits are required for our pets prior to placing them in their new forever homes. Do you own or rent your residence? If so, will you continue to use a crate?Will you take this canine to an obedience class?If you are married, have a significant other, have roommates, or have children, we will need to speak to the adults and meet all involved to make sure that everyone is in agreement and understands the commitment involved with adopting a pet.

9/1/16, Chloey went missing in the parking lot of the Michigan Humane Society in Westland, MI.  If you spot her or know of her whereabouts, please call, 734-612-8849 or 734-781-5381.  She had a purple patterned collar with these numbers on it and 'Rescue Dog' on it.  She is also Micro-chipped.  Still Missing.

Chloey is approximately 6-7 years old.  She is a sweet gal and playful.  She would do best in a home without small children.  She will make a nice addition to the right family.

Penny is a 4 year old mini Dachshund (approximate dob 9/11/13).  Homeward Bound rescued her from a puppy mill when she was 5 months old.  A couple with 3 other Dachshunds and 3 cats adopted her.  Due to a divorce they couldnât keep all of the animals. She is a very sweet little girl who LOVES to be held by her person.  She loves to sleep all night on the bed with her person(s) in her snuggle sack.

She was born completely deaf and with tunnel vision.  She now, sees very little but that and being deaf does not stop her love of life. She is used to going outside throughout the day to go potty and play so; she needs to go to a home where someone usually is home and not working outside of the home.  She canât be cage trained as she will immediately go potty in the cage when she is put in one.  She will go on the pee pad in a designated part of the home if no one is home to let her outside.  It would be best that the home not have small children as she is getting used to losing the rest of her sight.

Katie's DOB is approximately 10/26/11 and she weighs around 40 pounds. Katie and we believe it is her daughter Cassie were both found as strays roaming down a busy highway. Both were wearing heavy chains and padlocks around their neck and Cassie had been hit by a car.  We believe that both were used as bait dogs. From the looks of them, both have gone through a lot however, they are both the sweetest and friendliness dogs and just love to loved.  Cassie has already found a wonderful home.  Now it is Katie's turn to find her perfect forever home!  Katie does fine with kids and some dogs.  She has not been around cats.  She loves to play ball!

George was born on 12/3/2012 and weighs about 44 pounds.  He was originally adopted from Homeward Bound as a pup and since then his family situation has changed and they are no longer able to spend the time with George that George needs.  He is very smart, loves to play and cuddle, house and crate trained and good on leash. He is good with other dogs, only children 14 and above and he does not like cats. He does not like the water (ie lakes, pools).   George needs a home where someone will be home more than gone, able to give him the attention, time and exercise he needs, no small children.  He will make a nice addition to the right family.

FOLLOWING IS THE ONLINE APPLICATION---All questions must be answered COMPLETELY and you MUST be 21 years of age to be considered for one of our rescues:Please provide your home address including the cityand what the closest crossroads are?Could you please include a phone number that we may be able to contact you either during the day or evening and when it would be best to contact you.Do you have children?  if so, how many and their agesDo you have a fenced in yard?  if so, what type - privacy, cyclone, etc. If you do not have a fence, how will you let the animal outside? Do you own or rent your residence?  Is your residence a house, condo, mobile home, etc?If you rent, are pets allowed at your location?Have you ever owned a dog/cat or a puppy/kittenbefore?If so, what kind, do you still have them and if you don't, what happened to them?If you have been a pet owner before, could you pleaselist your veterinarian(s) name and phone number(s)?If you have been a pet owner before, was your petspayed or neutered, up to date on its shots and onheartworm preventative?If you are selected where will this animal be keptduring the day and where will it sleep at night?While at work how long will the animal be left homealone?If housebreaking is needed, how will you do this?Will you crate train?             If so, will you continue to use a crate?Will you take this canine to an obedience class?If you are married, have a significant other, have roommates, or have children, we will need to speak to the adults and meet all involved to make sure that  everyone is in agreement and understands the commitment involved with adopting a pet.

Great Dane Rescue Inc. is looking for caring, responsible Great Dane lovers to join our foster team by opening their homes and their hearts to a rescued Great Dane. These Gentle Giants do not 'kennel well' and our foster system allows volunteers to provide our orphans with a home environment in order to evaluate their habits and behaviors. 
Foster homes are responsible for the daily care of the foster Great Dane including feeding, exercising, medicating (as necessary), socializing, brushing and grooming, reinforcing basic obedience commands, observing and evaluating general behavior and temperament. And of course, providing love and security to a special orphan at a difficult time in their life when they have lost their former family and home. Great Dane Rescue Inc. provides foster home support and covers the cost of medical expenses. 
If you are interested in becoming a foster volunteer, please contact Great Dane Rescue Inc. today!

Sam is a handsome, deaf, 2 year old merlequin Great Dane.  Sam is super sweet and loves to meet new people (especially men). He is a puppy still in some ways and an adolescent too, so he needs someone with experience in Dane puppy raising and the preference would be for a home with experience with obedience training with a deaf dog. His ideal family would be calm but assertive and very consistent as he does try to push his limits like a typical adolescent boy. Sam is pretty darn smart and learns quickly. He does require structure and boundaries, just like all puppies. 

We are looking for a home with a fenced yard,  so he can run, do zoomies and play. Sam gets along very well with the other Danes in his foster family, but they are a little too old for his rough housing, so a dog buddy under 5 years old would be ideal. Sam cannot resist chasing the cat, so a home without cats would be best. He has lived with kids before and was good around them. Older kids would be best (12+) because Sam does have some food allergies and get can sick from certain foods. Since being in foster Sam's allergies have not been a problem, so he's not receiving any allergy shots.  He is receiving fish oil for dry skin and shedding. 

Sam likes to be outside but does get sunburned, so a nice shady yard and dog sun screen would be appreciated. He loves his people and does have a little bit of separation anxiety so a family that has someone home most all of the time would be wonderful for Sam. He was crated quite a bit at his previous ownersâ home and he is not fond of it. In foster he has been crated up to 3 hours and he is OK with it, but it does stress him.

He loves walks and car rides. He pulls a little bit on his leash so he is working on this with his foster, but continued obedience is part of the adoption contract. 

I think he will adjust easily into a new home. It only took about 5 days here.

Holly just turned 8 years old. At 55 pounds, she is UTD on her shots, spayed, been on heartworm preventative and microchipped. As a special bonus, she has a tail!! She is completely house trained as well as crate trained. Holly is a survivor and looking for a very special home.
She came to us over a year ago with lots of fear issues that resulted in snapping. She did not want to be touched, her feet were extremely sensitive, she pulled on the leash, wanted to chase cars, was disturbed by the headlights, did not like car rides, did not tolerate grooming and in general had many behaviors that would indicate something happened in her background. While we do not know the actual details, she either was completely ignored, mistreated, bullied by the other animals in the home or a combination of these. With calmness and patient guidance, she has improved immensely. She can now be touched, petted and likes belly rubs. She loves to be by her people and rests quietly on the couch next to you. Her front feet can still be a bit sensitive and brushing is not her favorite, but she does come to you for love and attention all the time. She was shaved down at the vetâs office under anesthesia as the visit to the groomers was just too traumatic for her. Grooming is still a challenge for her. 
She loves attention from calm adults. A quiet home setting with a fence would be ideal. Holly enjoys being outside and is quite playful with her balls and toys. If we are out with the other dogs, she will gently take the balls to a corner of the fenced in play area until she has them all. We retrieve them for all the dogs and play the game again. She can tend to be a bit bossy, letting the other dogs know when she thinks they are not behaving. Holly has been in foster the whole time with several other OES. An electronic fence will not work for her as the shock collar will only add to her distrust of her new family.
Hollyâs progress will be slow, and she may never be that dog that is eager to interact with strangers. New experiences can tend to be a threat to her and new things need to be presented slowly. With calm consistency and understanding, she will love her home and the adults in it. With commitment and love, this little girl will become a wonderful companion. Do you have what it takes to be Hollyâs hero?

Eleanor could not be a sweeter dog.  She is a black Great Dane and will be 7 years old in May and is up-to-date on all her medical needs.  She is wonderful with our kids and immediately got along with our lab mix and terrier mix.  She has never met a stranger and in the month we have had her we still have not hear her make a peep.  She is house trained and although she was crate trained at her previous home we leave her out in the house when we are gone with no issues at all.  Eleanor is an absolutely perfect dog but has some special needs that her adopter needs to be aware of.  Eleanor has epilepsy that is easily controlled with medication that she receives twice a day.  The medication can be purchased at any pharmacy and here in Ohio it costs $38 per month to maintain her dosage.  She has not had a seizure in the 2 months she has been in foster care.  At some point in her life her epilepsy was not well managed and she suffered a series of seizures that have apparently left her with impaired vision.  The ophthalmologist is not totally sure how much she can see but at minimum it is obvious she can see shapes as she navigates well around our house with little to no help.  With that said she does not do well with stairs and would likely do better in home with carpet, although our house is hard wood and she has done well.  We do have small rugs around for our own aging dog and those help with her navigating.  She will make a wonderful addition to a home that is willing to give her the extra attention she deserves.

willow update-- she is doing better about her separation anxiety and being afraid. if you go slow with her she loves everyone now, just not people in hoodies and thunderstorms. she still barks at people on the outside of her fence but when you invite them in she does way better i do not cage her when i am gone but she is never left alone for more than an hour or so. she does very well in her crate as long as it is quiet in the house and no one knocks while you are gone. she does have a bad habit of "making her bed" and has ripped a few blankies in her time. we are working on that. if you rub her belly she will love you forever and is very affectionate when she gets to know you. she does well with getting her nails done etc. she is not thrilled but will let you do it if you take it slow. i use a dremel so it is quicker and safer for me. be very careful about letting her sleep with you, because she has nightmares sometimes and if you wake her up she jumps up and snaps. she has not done this in about a year but i feel i need to tell you. she is very playful with other dogs and she is gentle with the smaller ones. she lives with a beagle mix right now and is good with him. she used to live with a pit mix and she played rough with him but she knows the difference between sizes and does quite well with all but the smallest of dogs, she doesn't know what to do with those lol. she knows a few commands but does not like to sit, i don't know why. she does know go lay down  and quite a few human phrases, but does not seem to like direct commands. she is very gentle taking treats and thinks she can sit in your lap on occasion. just tell her down. we are very careful not to get her in situations where she feels cornered because she was so terrified when we got her, so she is a very happy go lucky dog now. when we first went to get her at the pound she was trying to hide behind a chihuahua mix she came in with and wouldn't stay in the same room as my husband for the first month. she does well with my 8 year old grandson but he is very dog savvy and she knows him well and loves him very much. once you have her trust it is total. she will follow you anywhere and do what you want. she does do the coon hound fog horn when she sees a squirrel or other offensive animal in her yard and will give chase.  i know this is long and i'm sorry but she is a very special girl and once you get to know her you will see that smile emoticon

Freckles owner ran into financial hardship and was about to lose his home and have to live in his car.  After several shelters refused to take his dog,  (they would only euthanize him - age 14) he turned to his vet.  His vet made several calls, hoping to find him a home.   Furry Friends took him in.  He is a very sweet, laid back, calm old guy.  He loves to run in the yard, sleep in the sun, and play gently with the other dogs.  Can you find a spot in your home and heart to take in this senior fella to live out his life ?


For more information, contact his foster mom, Pat, at  248 860 5688  or at  dogladyffr@yahoo.com

Abby came to us when her mom entered a nursing home and couldn't bring her along.  She loves everyone and gives kisses to all.  She is great with most dogs and well behaved.  She does have several medical issues - occasional seizures and eye issues.  She requires daily pills and eye drops for those issues..  A fenced yard is required, since Beagle's noses tend to get them in trouble.  She loves attention and would love to cuddle.  

For more information, contact her foster mom, Pat, at 248 860 5688  or at  dogladyffr@yahoo.com

Arrival Story:  Wagginâ Tails answered a plea from a shelter to get this girl into rescue because she wasnât handling shelter life well after being relinquished by her family due to a divorce.
Approximate Age/Weight: 5 years / 85 lbs.

Personality:   Hannah arrived at Wagginâ Tails in a pretty stressed state of mind.  There was so much change and not much structure in her life, but with help from her foster family and a good trainer, Hannah has made great progress in becoming a confident, balanced dog.  

She is a smart girl who was looking for guidance from humans.  Hannah is treat motivated and âworksâ for her meals (stuffed kongs, snufflemat, food puzzles) now.  Hannah knows basic commands, is crate-trained, and has great house manners. 

Silly, playful, and will never turn down a good game of fetch, Hannah will be happy to curl up with you afterwards for a nap on the couch.  Hannah is friendly, affectionate, and enjoys chewing on toys, but never anything inappropriate.  

Our fun girl enjoys swimming, boating and drinking from a garden hose on a hot day.  Walks make her happy, and she has now learned to check in with eye contact while walking. Hannah can be cautious of newly introduced things in her life. She will thrive in a structured (but not rigid) home environment where she knows what the routine is. 

Forever Home:  Hannah is a beautiful dog who won over her foster family immediately.   She would do best in a low-key home, but would love to be part of a family who will teach her new things as she is a smarty pants.  She enjoys interacting with humans and will want to be near you.   Hannah has great house manners and knows to wait at doors, gates and stairs.

Hannah gets along with and enjoys walking with her male canine housemate, but can be selective when it comes to other dogs.  We know Hannah would prefer to have you all to herself!  Due to Hannah's size, a family with older children suits her best.  

 Fenced yard only.  No invisible fences, please.


Contact: Please contact wtdr2008@yahoo.com if interested in adopting Hannah.

Arrival Story:  Moose was surrendered by his family.

Approximate Age/Weight: 3 years old / 60 lbs.

Personality:  Moose is a  fun-loving boy who loves to run and play as well as take long walks with his people.  He is a sensitive and super sweet boy who enjoys baby-talk, responds to his nickname, Moosie, and loves getting pets.  He's a super snuggler who loves attention and affection, but is content to relax quietly in the company of his people when they are busy doing people stuff. 

Moose is not a jumper and has good house manners. He enjoys playing with dogs his size who he's come to know and trust.  He does better with slow introductions to new dogs until he feels comfortable.  Moose would also do fine as the only dog in the household as long as he is surrounded by affection, attention and love. He loves older children and is a great companion for them. 

Moose prefers walking on quiet trails and country roads as opposed to city streets, which can make him a little nervous.   

Moose overall is a loving, easy-going boy who just goes with the flow and enjoys the companionship of his family.  

Forever Home: Moose will need a family willing to give him some time to adjust to a new home, routine, and continue his loose-leash training.  He'd do well with a canine companion his size or as the only dog soaking up all the love. Moose would do well with older children who know how to respect dogs.  Moose requires a fenced in yard and a home without cats.  No electric fences for Moose. 

Contact: Please contact wtdr2008@yahoo.com if interested in adopting Moose.

Arrival Story: Earl came to Waggin Tails after his previous owners were unable to take care of him.  He has allergies that had gotten out of control and this poor guy was pretty miserable.  Waggin Tails has been able to find some medication that controls Earlâs itching.  He is very nervous at the vetâs office, but weâve found a great vet who gently works with Earl to ease his fears using fear-free methods. 
 
Approximate Age/Weight: 7-8 years / 72 lbs.
 
Personality:  Earl is a super smart and sweet dog.  He makes his foster parents laugh every day with his antics!  He was a superstar in his training class and graduated with flying colors!    

Earl LOVES to play fetch!  Tennis balls or other dog toys, it doesnât matter.  He will bring the ball back to you or set it down near you non-stop.  He will also point at it so you know exactly what he wants.    When playtime is over, Earl does settle down nicely for naps - even if the tennis ball is still in his mouth!  

This smart guy loves to go for walks and has learned to walk nicely on leash.  Good boy, Early Bird!

Earl likes to cuddle up and get belly rubs.   He has great house manners, too!

He would make a great agility, free-style dance or possible dock diving dog - he would do really well with some kind of job or sport.  He is wicked smart and food motivated, so heâs very easily trained and would rise to the challenge.  He really enjoys learning new tricks!

There are three other dogs in his foster home and Earl gets along with all of them.  He doesnât try to engage in play with them, but heâs also not opposed to settling down next to one of the other dogs and chewing on a Nylabone.  He has shown no interest in the resident cat, but is interested in squirrels and birds in the back yard.
 
Forever Home: We would love to see Earl go to a home with some dog experience and a fenced in yard so that he can run after tennis balls/toys safely.  After all that heâs been through, handsome Earl needs to be with someone who is willing to give him the attention and playtime that he deserves.  While Earl behaves nicely around children, a home without young children is ideal.  If you're looking for a super fun and funny guy, he may be the one for you!


Contact:  Please contact wtdr2008@yahoo.com if you're interested in adopting Earl.     .

Waggin' Tails Adoption Information:  Waggin' Tails Dog Rescue has a standard adoption fee of $225 for adult dogs.  Different adoption fees apply for older dogs, small breeds and puppies - $125 for senior dogs (9 years +) , $275 for small breed dogs and $250 for puppies, plus a $50 deposit which is returned upon proof of spay/neuter. Arrival Story: Waggin' Tails found Gizmo at Detroit Animal Care and Control.  After meeting and playing with Gizmo, we knew we had to help this happy dog find a great new family.

Approximate Age/Weight: 3 years / 50 lbs.

Personality:  Gizmo is a silly, playful little bundle of brindle happiness.  We met him at the shelter where he won over one of our volunteers during a play session.  Gizmo has a gentle mouth and takes treats gently and drops toys easily.  He loves toys, eating meals out of Kongs and chewing on bully sticks. He does act puppyish and still sometimes mouths hands when playing (no biting, just mouthing) so we're working on that.  He graduated from Training Buddies, Mind Your Manners class.  

Gizmo has had a DNA test and we discovered that he is 78.5% American Staffordshire Terrier with 12.% of mixed breed identifiable as only parts of the sporting, hound, and mountain dog groups.   Gizmo is a svelt 50lbs full grown.

Gizmo has good house manners and hasn't played with anything other than his toys in the house.  He took to crate training easily. 
 
Gizmo is a fun dog who really enjoys time with people, is making good eye contact and checking in with his handler on walks. He is a leaner, and will curl into you for some pets or sit on your lap for snuggle time.  He would love to sleep with you and provide warmth on cold nights.  Giz is great at morning snuggles!   Our boy is adventurous and likes to explore and follows his nose wherever it goes. He wears a harness on walks. Gizmo is good on car rides but needs to be secured or heâll be trying to drive.   Gizmo is treat-motivated and wants to learn and is super smart.  He is more busy-body than couch potato and likes to know what is going on the house so he is happy to tag along when you do chores.  He is not much of a barker and likes to sit at the front window and watch the neighborhood goings on.  Gizmo doesn't bark at people or dogs passing by.
 
Forever Home: Gizmo could fit into many different home situations.  He would likely knock over a little one with his bouncy, happy-go-lucky nature so older kids would be best.  He is young and still needs a good amount of playtime.

Contact: Please contact wtdr2008@yahoo.com if interested in adopting Gizmo!

I did some time at the River Rouge shelter.  I was relinquished after having a litter of pups because the other pregnant female in the home and I squabbled.  It was a bad situation.

Let me start by saying that I am much more beautiful in person.  It is hard to capture the essence of my soft brindle coat until you meet me in person.  And, just wait until you stroke my silky ears while we cuddle!   I am the best at cuddles.  And, playing fetch!

I am sound sensitive and a bit of an anxious dog but I know there is a special person/couple that will see past that and cherish all of the unique gifts I have to offer as a 4-legged companion.  I know basic commands and have good house manners.

So, here is the nitty grittyâ¦ I hear all and would like to bring everything to your attention because you do not hear things as well as I do.  I would make an excellent watch dog, alerting you to when squirrels, or other danger, is near.   It takes me time to get to know and trust humans, but once I get to know you, weâll be friends for life.   A home without a lot of visitors is ideal for me.   I can be apprehensive in new situations, but with your guidance, patience, and some high-value treats I know that we can do anything together.   I currently live in a close-knit suburban neighborhood and it is probably a little too much for a dog like me.  My best defense is going on the offense (barking) when in the back yard, when neighbors or other dogs appear so I will need help from my humans to redirect me and help build my confidence.  I can be choosy about my dog pals and I like to chase cats but I do currently live with both.  

I am a hoot at playing fetch and I have learned so many fun things in my foster home.  Playing ball is what I like most!   Chain link fence?  I can hike over that easily so I need to be monitored outside or have a privacy fence.  You put a cheeseburger on the ground in front of me and I will wait patiently until you say I can have it.  Cheeseburgers are my favorite!  No, wait.  Playing fetch is my favorite.  We can figure this out later.

Forever home:  A quieter, adult-only home is ideal for me.  I would love to be your canine security officer!  When off-duty I enjoy fetch, chewing on a bone, following humans around the house, and then settle down for snuggles when the Netflix comes on.  While I am not a good fit for the first-time pet parent, I do just need a special someone to take a chance on me.  No electric fences, please.

Please contact wtdr2008@yahoo.com if youâre interested in making me yours.  
Love, Diamond

Diamonds DNA test stated that she is:  25% Amer Staffordshire Terrier, 25% Dog de Bordeaux, 12.5% Bullmastiff, and 12.5% mixed breeds from the Guard Group in the following order - Boston Terrier, Boxer, Great Dane, American Staffordshire Terrier.

Arrival story:   These three pups (one female / two males) were born while in the care of a Wagginâ Tails foster home.  Their mom, Eve, a shepherd mix, was pulled from Detroit Animal Care and Control and surprised us with her buns in the oven.  Eve has a sweet disposition and has been a great, playful mom to her babies.  All three pups are typical for their age in that they are still working on housetraining and learning not to chew things they shouldnât.

Age:  10 weeks old as of 4-3-18 and 14-16lbs. each (anticipate pups will grow to medium size).  All are up-to-date with age-appropriate vaccinations.

REBEL  (female, black and white) loves to snuggle but will tell you when has had enough.  She is a quick learner and loves to play with toys.  Rebel can be unsure in new environments but will warm up with your reassurance.  She has a moderate energy level and knows sit.

SCAMP (male, black with speckles) is always up for adventure. He loves exploring new places and things. He definitely let's his curiosity take over sometimes and will need a tour guide at all times.  Scamp has a moderate energy level and has attended puppy daycare and knows sit.

RASCAL (male, brown and tan) is always on the go. He loves to play with toys and keeps himself entertained. He will need some work on socializing with new dogs appropriately but loves to meet new dogs and people.  Rascal is the last pup to settle down for a nap and the first one up.  He has a go-go-go energy level, has attended puppy daycare and knows sit.

Forever Home:   Are you ready for a pup?  They are a lot of work! Our young pups are looking for loving and dedicated people/families to teach them all the things young pups need to learn to become well-mannered, confident, canine companions.  

Contact:  Please contact wtdr2008@yahoo.com if youâre interested in adopting Rebel, Rascal or Scamp.
